report_title: Copier & Office Equipment Wholesaling in the US
executive_summary: Digitalization has increasingly siphoned demand for office equipment away from the Copier and Office Equipment Wholesalers industry. The COVID-19 pandemic accelerated the digitization of operations across various industries as many offices implemented remote or hybrid work policies. A strong recovery in corporate profit limited the decline in sales for office equipment wholesalers, but the relief was short-lived.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Digitalization will continue to stifle office equipment sales
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: As software and productivity services improve, the benefits of switching away from office equipment will expand.
Widespread business closures prompted by the COVID-19 pandemic jumpstarted a trend toward hybrid and remote work.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: A SURGE IN CORPORATE SPENDING PROVIDES TEMPORARY RELIEF
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Amid pandemic recoveries, corporate profit shot up.
A larger trend toward digitalization will cut wholesalers' recovery short.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: REMOTE WORK TO THREATEN OFFICE EQUIPMENT
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: More companies will embrace flexible remote policies over the next five years.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: WHOLESALERS SET TO MAXIMIZE THEIR VALUE THROUGH ADDITIONAL SERVICES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: To compete effectively, major wholesalers will expand their businesses to provide value-added services.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: ENVIRONMENTAL REGULATIONS WILL REDUCE PAPER TRAILS
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: New regulations to reduce waste may force businesses to switch to more eco-friendly equipment.

industry_definition: Industry operators wholesale a range of office equipment, such as calculators, dictating machines, mail machines and point-of-sale systems.
key_trends: COVID-19 accelerated digitalization across downstream businesses, threatening sales of office equipment.
Office equipment wholesalers are consolidating to cut costs and offering new services to expand revenue channels.
Remote and hybrid work policies will continue to minimize the need for office equipment.
There are no regulations specific to copier and office equipment wholesalers.
An increase in business conducted online has hindered copier and office equipment sales.
Upstream product innovations benefit office equipment wholesalers that stock technologically-advanced products.
Vertical integration reduces intermediary wholesalers' role in distribution.
Office equipment wholesale establishments are concentrated near large metropolitan areas or manufacturing centers.
The Southeast's large population attracts office equipment wholesalers to the region.
Vertically-integrated manufacturers heighten competition for traditional wholesalers.
Computer software is the largest source of external competition.
Integrated wholesaler-retailers utilize e-commerce to maximize sales.

market_segmentation.segment_description: This segment includes all sales to retailers for resale.
This market segment includes all federal, state and local government bodies.
This segment includes purchases from various businesses and other miscellaneous customers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Copiers and Copier Parts and Equipment
products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes copiers and copier parts and equipment.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Mailing, Letter Handling and Addressing Machines
products_and_services.product_description: This segment includes mailing, letter handling and addressing machines.
This segment consists of various photocopy and film equipment designed for businesses.

Office Staffing & Temp Agencies in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Typewriters are primarily sold as nostalgic pieces but still support a portion of revenue.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast provides wholesalers with a substantial labor pool since it's the most populated region in the US.
Many wholesalers choose to settle in the West to be near office equipment manufacturers.
Several of the largest cities in the US (New York City, Washington DC) are in the Mid-Atlantic.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH AND SAFETY ADMINISTRATION (OSHA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The OSHA sets regulations and standards to ensure employees' safe and healthy working conditions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Copier and office equipment wholesaling is labor-intensive.

basis_points.basis_description: Integrating manufacturing and wholesaling operations is more cost-effective.
Computer software is the largest source of external competition.

concentration_points.concentration_description: Amid waning demand for copier and office equipment, wholesalers are consolidating.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Consolidation enables investment in new technologies
concentration_points.concentration_description: Consolidation also enables wholesalers to invest in new technologies.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: LOW-COST IMPORTS AT THE MANUFACTURING LEVEL LIMIT PURCHASE COST FLUCTUATIONS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Upstream manufacturers often import office equipment from low-labor-cost countries, which keeps prices low.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Copier and office equipment wholesaling is labor-intensive.
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: New entrants must be prepared to invest in personnel and training.

volatility_points.volatility_title: DIGITALIZATION SLOWS COPIER AND OFFICE EQUIPMENT SALES
volatility_points.volatility_description: As more businesses have shifted to digital operations, sales of traditional office equipment, like copiers, have decelerated.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: COPIERS AND COPIER PARTS AND EQUIPMENT GET MORE ADVANCED
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Environmental consciousness has precipitated demand for more efficient multifunction machines.

FAQs.question: How do shifts in consumer preferences toward things like increased digitalization and sustainability affect your business?
FAQs.answer: Online products not only enable companies to be more organized, but also take up less space and are more environmentally friendly than industry products, leading to declines in demand during the period.

FAQs.question: How did COVID-19 impact your business?
FAQs.answer: Federal and state guidelines surrounding the COVID-19 pandemic included temporary shelter-in-place orders and closures of nonessential businesses.

FAQs.question: What is the Independent Office Products and Furniture Dealers Association (IOPFDA)?
FAQs.answer: The IOPFDA represents independent office equipment dealers.

FAQs.question: How do you adjust your marketing during poor economic conditions?
FAQs.answer: The industry is highly dependent on the state of the economy, particularly business sentiment, private aggregate investment and corporate profit.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored growth opportunities via mergers or acquisitions?
FAQs.answer: Merger and acquisition activity has increased substantially.

FAQs.question: What methods are in place to ensure effective stock maintenance?
FAQs.answer: Ability to control stock on hand increases profitability by keeping stock holding costs to a minimum while maximizing sales opportunities.
